resources.string: Test your ability to estimate whether exchanges are favorable

This game tests your ability to estimate whether it\'s worth it to attack a particular unit, based on 1) the probability of victory, and 2) the shield costs of the fighting units.\n\nThe favorability of the exchange is measured as Expected Shields, or ES, a measure of how many enemy shields you expect to destroy in exchange for 100 shields worth of your attacking units. For example, an ES of 30 means for every 100 shields of your attacking units, 30 shields of defending units are destroyed (very bad), while an ES of 200 indicates that you expect your enemy to lose 200 shields for every 100 you lose (very good).
